Material.name: Acrylic
Material.description: A synthetic fiber made from polymer fibers, often used as a substitute for wool.
Material.applications: Commonly found in sweaters, blankets, and upholstery. It is lightweight, warm, and resistant to wrinkles.

Material.name: Aertex
Material.description: A lightweight, breathable fabric made from loosely woven cotton.
Material.applications: Used in sportswear and summer clothing due to its breathable qualities.

Material.name: Alpaca
Material.description: A natural fiber sourced from alpaca animals, similar to wool but softer and warmer.
Material.applications: Often used in luxury scarves, sweaters, and blankets.

Material.name: Canvas
Material.description: A heavy-duty, plain-woven fabric made from cotton or linen.
Material.applications: Used in sails, tents, bags, and artist's canvases.

Material.name: Cashmere
Material.description: A luxurious fiber obtained from cashmere goats, known for its softness and warmth.
Material.applications: Used in high-end sweaters, scarves, and coats.

Material.name: Chenille
Material.description: A soft, fuzzy fabric made from twisted yarns with a velvet-like texture.
Material.applications: Used in blankets, sweaters, and upholstery.

Material.name: Chiffon
Material.description: A lightweight, sheer fabric made from silk, nylon, or polyester.
Material.applications: Used in evening wear, scarves, and dresses.

Material.name: Cotton
Material.description: A soft, breathable natural fiber harvested from cotton plants.
Material.applications: Used universally in clothing, bed linens, towels, and countless other applications.

Material.name: Crepe
Material.description: A lightweight fabric with a crinkled or pebbled surface, often made from silk or wool.
Material.applications: Used in dresses, blouses, and formal wear.

Material.name: Damask
Material.description: A reversible, patterned fabric made of silk, wool, or synthetic fibers.
Material.applications: Often found in table linens, upholstery, and formal clothing.

Material.name: Denim
Material.description: A durable cotton twill fabric, typically blue and used for jeans.
Material.applications: Primarily used in jeans, jackets, and casual wear.

Material.name: Flannel
Material.description: A soft, brushed cotton or wool fabric that is warm and comfortable.
Material.applications: Commonly used in pajamas, shirts, and bedding.

Material.name: Georgette
Material.description: A lightweight, crinkled fabric made from silk or polyester.
Material.applications: Commonly used in dresses, blouses, and scarves.

Material.name: Gingham
Material.description: A lightweight cotton fabric with a checkered or plaid pattern.
Material.applications: Used in shirts, dresses, and tablecloths.

Material.name: Jersey
Material.description: A stretchy, knit fabric made from cotton, wool, or synthetic fibers.
Material.applications: Used in t-shirts, dresses, and activewear.

Material.name: Lace
Material.description: A delicate, openwork fabric made from cotton, silk, or synthetic fibers.
Material.applications: Used in bridal wear, lingerie, and home d√©cor.

Material.name: Linen
Material.description: A strong, breathable fabric made from flax fibers.
Material.applications: sed in summer clothing, bed linens, and tablecloths.

Material.name: leather
Material.description: A durable and flexible material made from the processed hides of animals, primarily cattle.
Material.applications: Leather is widely used in fashion (jackets, shoes, belts, bags), upholstery (sofas, car interiors), and accessories (wallets, gloves).

Material.name: Microfiber
Material.description: A synthetic fiber finer than silk, usually made from polyester or nylon.
Material.applications: Used in cleaning cloths, towels, and high-performance sportswear.

Material.name: Muslin
Material.description: A lightweight cotton fabric with a plain weave.
Material.applications: Used in dressmaking, curtains, and as a backing for embroidery.

Material.name: Nylon
Material.description: A strong, elastic synthetic fabric known for its durability and water resistance.
Material.applications: Used in stockings, swimwear, and outdoor gear.

Material.name: Olefin
Material.description: A synthetic fiber that is lightweight, strong, and resistant to stains.
Material.applications: Used in carpets, upholstery, and sportswear.

Material.name: Polyester
Material.description: A durable, synthetic fabric resistant to wrinkles and shrinking.
Material.applications: Used in clothing, home textiles, and industrial fabrics.

Material.name: Rayon
Material.description: A semi-synthetic fiber made from cellulose, with a smooth texture and good drape.
Material.applications: Used in dresses, blouses, and linings.

Material.name: Satin
Material.description: A glossy fabric with a smooth surface, often made from silk or polyester.
Material.applications: Used in evening wear, lingerie, and decorative items.

Material.name: Silk
Material.description: A luxurious natural fiber produced by silkworms, known for its smooth texture and sheen.
Material.applications: Used in fine garments, such as evening gowns, scarves, and ties.

Material.name: Velvet
Material.description: a luxurious, soft fabric with a dense pile, giving it a distinctive plush texture and sheen.
Material.applications: Velvet is commonly used in high-end fashion (dresses, jackets, evening gowns), upholstery (sofas, chairs), and home decor (curtains, cushions).
